intro: Stachytarpheta orubica, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking violet or purple flower clusters that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are tubular and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Stachytarpheta orubica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
